org.unallocatedspace.uasapp
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  org.unallocatedspace.uasapp.Data
Direct Known Subclasses:
Info
public class Data
extends java.lang.Object

Creates time-sensitive data banks. Provides caching and couples data with a timestamp metadata. Timestamp is useful to determine if data has grown too old and needs to be updated.

TODO: Overload the Data constructor with one that only requires a text argument. This constructor takes the from the current activity or application.

Constructor Summary
Data(Activity activity, java.lang.String text)
          Opens a shared preference to cache recent information.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getLastUpdate()
          Returns a String with a Formated timestamp of data.
 java.lang.String getMessage()
          Returns the data stored in this bank or "" if the bank is uninitiated.
 boolean isStale()
          Returns true if data stored is older than 15 minutes.
 boolean isStale(long duration)
          Returns true if data is older then duration.
 void setMessage()
          Clears out current data and reset timestamp to the present.
 void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
          Sets data with a custom message and updates current timestamp.
 void setMessage(java.lang.String message, long timestamp)
          Sets data with a custom message and an arbitrary timestamp.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Data

public Data(Activity activity,
            java.lang.String text)
Opens a shared preference to cache recent information. NOTE: If cache doesn't have an entry, do not make one. Let setMessage() initate the cache.
